description: Integrate Phase 1 scanner improvements into coderef-workflow planning and execution workflows. Leverage 95% accurate AST scanner data, relationship graphs (dependencies, imports, calledBy), and complexity metrics (ComplexityScorer) to enhance planning accuracy, impact analysis, and execution tracking.
goal: Improve planning workflows with full type coverage (interfaces, decorators), automated impact analysis using relationship graphs, and complexity-based effort estimation for execution tracking
requirements: Planning workflows include interfaces, decorators, type aliases from AST scanner
Impact analysis uses relationship graphs (ElementData.dependencies, ElementData.calledBy, ElementData.imports) for transitive dependencies
Execution tracking incorporates complexity-based effort estimation using ComplexityScorer
Backward compatible with pre-Phase 1 scanner data
constraints: No breaking changes to workflow API
Handle missing complexity/relationship fields gracefully (backward compatibility)
Maintain performance - impact analysis must be fast
All implementations in Python (coderef-workflow is Python-based)
